title: Zachary Pollari
text:
Zachary Pollari (born October 2, 1986) is a former <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a> <a href="offensive%20tackle">offensive tackle</a> for the <a href="Toronto%20Argonauts">Toronto Argonauts</a> of the <a href="Canadian%20Football%20League">Canadian Football League</a>. He was drafted by the Argonauts in the fourth round of the <a href="2009%20CFL%20Draft">2009 CFL Draft</a>. Pollari was later released by the Argonauts on June 17, 2010 after a game vs the <a href="Hamilton%20Tiger-Cats">Hamilton Tiger-Cats</a> in which he fractured his sternum. After his recovery, he competed for Canada at the IFAF World Championship In Vienna, Austria in the summer of 2011. He was selected as a 1st Team All-star at the tournament. That fall, he re-signed with the Toronto Argonauts on October 19, 2011. He was ultimately released on June 13, 2012. He played <a href="CIS%20football">CIS football</a> for the <a href="Western%20Ontario%20Mustangs">Western Ontario Mustangs</a> from 2005 - 2009.
Pollari now lives in Guelph and is a teacher and coach at Centennial Collegiate Vocational Institute.
